name: JavaToolInstaller
description: Acquires a specific version of Java from a user supplied Azure blob or the tools cache and adds it to the PATH. Use this step to change the version of Java used in the Java steps.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: versionSpec
inputs.label: JDK Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: A number that specifies the JDK version to make available on the path.

inputs.name: jdkPath
inputs.label: JDK path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to where the compressed JDK is located. The path could be in your source repository or a local path on the agent.

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the Azure Resource Manager subscription for the JDK.

inputs.name: storageAccountName
inputs.label: Storage Account Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Classic and Resource Manager storage accounts are listed. Select the Storage account name in which the JDK is located.

inputs.name: containerName
inputs.label: Container Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the container in the storage account in which the JDK is located.

inputs.name: commonVirtualPath
inputs.label: Common Virtual Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the JDK inside the Azure storage container.

inputs.name: destinationFolder
inputs.label: Destination folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Destination folder into which JDK should be extracted.

inputs.name: cleanDestinationFolder
inputs.label: Clean destination folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select this option to clean the destination directory before JDK is extracted into it.
